text: How fast a unit can capture different locations in settlement battles.
This increases a unit's melee attack and damage when charging. This does not represent the physical impact of the charge.
The melee bonus this unit receives when fighting against elephants.
A long range enables you to hit enemies from a distance, but weapons are still more accurate at shorter ranges.
This determines the chance of a unit being hit whilst in melee.||This only works in melee and provides no protection from missiles!
The speed at which the unit moves around the battlefield.

The amount of ammunition this unit can carry into battle.||Once this has been exhausted the unit will be forced to switch to melee to continue fighting.||After the battle, ammunition is fully replenished.
This determines the chance of a successful hit on the enemy when the unit is engaged in melee.||Battle-hardened troops will gain experience through melee, improving this skill.
Determines who strikes first at the beginning of combat.
The damage caused by a unit's weapon, split between base and armour piercing.||Armour-piercing damage is always applied; base damage can be blocked by armour.
The percentage chance that the shield will block (non-artillery) missiles. (%)
Defence or evasion bonus attained from the shield.
The rate at which this unit can fire.||This is improved with experience.
The likelihood of hitting the enemy when firing.
This determines how many hits a unit can withstand alongside armour and melee defence.
From how far a unit can spot enemies.
How resistant a unit is to missile fire and melee attacks.
The melee bonus this unit receives when fighting against cavalry and elephants.
The melee bonus this unit receives when fighting against infantry.
How much fire damage the ship can sustain before catching fire.
A unit with high morale is less likely to rout in the face of danger. Morale is improved by experience in battle.

The damage caused by a missile attack, split between base, armour piercing and explosive.||Armour-piercing damage is always applied, base and explosive damage can be blocked by armour.||Explosive damage has an area of effect.
How well this unit can hide.
Mass of each entity in the unit.
How quickly the ship is able to move.
A way to change the default range at which a unit can spot others hiding.
Default number of men a unit has.
The additional speed used for charging the final distance to the target.
The rate that the unit slows to a stop.
The rate at which the unit accelerates.
